lines.text: What are you trying to do, put the B on me?
I'm trying to put nothing on you. You have enough on already. Now, if you answer my questions, you can go right back to your artwork!

[to telephone operator who is putting on thick make-up]
Now that you've got your disguise on, I would like to ask you a few questions. That is if you talk through all that make-up.
It takes a certain type to be a detective.
Well, I've noticed that.
Funny how simple the answers are when we know them.
If that penguin could talk I bet he'd tell us who the murderer was.
No homework. What a prize. Oy.
Are you sure it was a man's voice?
Well it ain't likely a woman'd be calling me baby, is it?
No, not so far downtown as this. Now, baby, I mean, eh, get the Chief Operator to trace that call. Tell her to report to Inspector Piper at Police Headquarters.
[Pointing to the Telephone Operator's lipstick]
Oh, next time use a lighter shade. That's a little vulgar. Au revoir.
Okay, Lydia Pinkham.

[Hovering over Parker's dead body]
It looks to me like a clear case of homicide.
Heh! I realized that a half hour ago. That's why I had one of my students call the police, hmmm?

[Sarcastically]
I'm surprised you thought the police necessary.
I was with my class of pupils.
Where are those pupils. Whatta yuh mean by letting them go home?
Letting them? Huh, I see you have no children of your own, Inspector. The moment you order everyone to stay, they, uh-uh,
[She clears her throat]
... I believe the word is "scram."

[In the aquarium]
What are you doin' hangin' around this fish house?
Well, it's Friday, isn't it?
It isn't Friday for wisecracks!
Say, what are you? A policewoman?
As far as it concerns you, I'm connected to the detective bureau... not very pleasantly... but connected still.

[after discovering Donovan unconcious in the men's bathroom]
Well?
Uh, I was just sitting there and something hit me on the head.

[Sarcastically]
It's a good thing it was your head!

[Walking back to his table in the courtroom]
Your honor, I've finished with the witness.
You may be finished with the witness, Mr. Costello, but the witness is not finished with you!
Miss Withers, you took the very words right out of my mouth.
Don't worry, you'll have plenty left.
And if I haven't, you've got a couple!
Phooey! What's good looks got to do with romance?
Young man, have you ever looked at yourself in the mirror?
Sure. Have you?
I was in hopes you wouldn't bring that up.
My hat pin! It's gone! It's gone! Well, children, why don't you do something! Don't stand there like a lot of grown-ups! Teacher's lost her hat pin!
Some kid called up and said there was a dead man in swimmin' with the ducks.

Well, really, Inspector. What do you suppose I was doing here with my class of pupils? Entertaining the fish? I'm a school teacher. And I might have done wonders with you if I'd caught you young enough.
I'd never trust a man who was a penguin fancier.
Well, I wouldn't want to live with one if he kept bringing them home with him.
Did you notice Gwen Parker's, eh, legs, Inspector?
Who didn't it!
I mean her stockings. They both have stains on them.
Stains? Good, I'll look into that.
You do alright by yourself in the way of vittels, don't you?
I suppose you thought school teachers lived on chalk and old blotting paper.
Well to be frank, I never gave it much thought what school teachers did.
Oh, you penguin fanciers, you're such flatterers.
That's the secret of our success with penguins.
Well, some good woman is losing a very pleasant husband by it.
Oh, Hello Miss Withers, what's on your chest?
None of your business.
Oh, if you want us to hit on anything more, just let me know.
Oh, come on back, Miss Withers. I think maybe we can get together on something at that.
All you're after is a conviction, anybody's conviction. I never saw such a man!
How many men have you seen?
Plenty of them.
Mr. Hemingway, these are the stockings worn by Mrs. Gwen Parker on the day that her husband was murdered. Perhaps you remember them.
I remember admiring the appearance of Mrs. Parker's, eh, limb.
The Prosecution claims that the fish stains on these stockings prove that Mrs. Parker must have gone behind the tanks in the aquarium.
Well, I'll be a so-and-so.
I'm not the emotional type, Mr. Piper, but even you must get a little thrill, out of the thought, that we, you and I, helped those young people to this happiness.

[Looking out a window at Philip Seymour slap Gwen Parker in the face]
That a boy! That baby's had that coming to her for a long time.
